data.title: 43 Best Things to Do in Zagreb, Croatia (with Photos)
data.meta_description: Embark on an unforgettable adventure in Zagreb, Croatia's vibrant capital.
data.text:
Embark on an unforgettable adventure in Zagreb, Croatia’s vibrant capital.

In the list below, I will unveil the top 43 must-do experiences that will make your visit truly exceptional.

From exploring historic streets to savoring local delicacies, get ready to immerse yourself in the essence of this charming city.

Continue reading to unlock the best of Zagreb!

1. Stroll through Ban Jelačić Square, the city’s main square

Ban Jelačić Square is the bustling heart of Zagreb, pulsating with vibrant energy and historical significance.

This iconic square serves as a central gathering point, surrounded by charming cafes, shops, and restaurants.

Its strategic location offers easy access to explore nearby attractions, making it an ideal starting point for your Zagreb adventure.

The square’s rich history, marked by the equestrian statue of Ban Jelačić, adds a sense of cultural immersion and provides a perfect spot for people-watching.

Whether you’re seeking shopping, dining, or a taste of local life, Ban Jelačić Square offers a quintessential Zagreb experience in a single captivating space.

2. Visit Dolac Market, Zagreb’s bustling farmers’ market

Dolac Market is a vibrant and bustling culinary haven in Zagreb that beckons visitors with its authentic charm and fresh produce.

Nestled at the heart of the city, this open-air market is a sensory delight, offering a kaleidoscope of colors, aromas, and flavors.

Strolling through its lively stalls, you’ll connect with local culture and witness the daily rhythm of Zagreb life.

From organic fruits and vegetables to artisanal cheeses and traditional Croatian delicacies, Dolac Market is a treasure trove for food enthusiasts and an ideal spot to savor the tastes of the region.

Whether you’re seeking farm-fresh ingredients or an immersive cultural experience, a visit to Dolac Market is a culinary adventure that immerses you in the heart of Zagreb’s gastronomic heritage.

3. Explore the historic Upper Town (Gornji Grad)

Exploring Upper Town (Gornji Grad) in Zagreb offers a captivating journey through centuries of history and culture.

This charming and historic district boasts cobbled streets, medieval architecture, and captivating views of the city below.

Visitors can admire the iconic St. Mark’s Church with its intricate tiled roof, delve into the city’s past at the Croatian History Museum, and discover hidden gems like the charming Stone Gate.

The atmosphere is a blend of old-world charm and artistic vibrancy, as local artisans and galleries thrive in this cultural hub.

Whether you’re intrigued by history, architecture, or artistic expression, a visit to Upper Town promises an enriching experience that transports you to the heart of Zagreb’s heritage.

4. Admire St. Mark’s Church with its colorful tiled roof

Visiting St. Mark’s Church in Zagreb is a captivating journey into Croatia’s rich history and architectural beauty.

The church’s most iconic feature is its colorful and intricate tiled roof, which proudly displays the coats of arms of Croatia, Dalmatia, and Slavonia.

Its Gothic and Romanesque architectural elements, dating back to the 13th century, evoke a sense of medieval charm and significance.

Inside, visitors can marvel at stunning frescoes and religious artwork that provide insights into the region’s cultural and spiritual heritage.

Perched atop the historic Upper Town, St. Mark’s Church offers not only a glimpse into Croatia’s past but also breathtaking panoramic views of the city below, making it an essential stop for anyone seeking to immerse themselves in Zagreb’s captivating heritage.

5. Discover Lotrščak Tower and its iconic cannon firing at noon

Visiting Lotrščak Tower in Zagreb is like stepping into a real-life castle adventure.

This tall and old tower has a big cannon on top that goes BOOM every day at noon, which is really exciting to see and hear.

You can also go up the tower and look out from the top to see the whole city like a superhero.

Inside, there’s a special museum where you can learn about how the tower was used a long time ago to keep the city safe.

It’s like a time machine that takes you back to when knights and guards protected the city walls.

So, if you want to feel like a brave knight and learn cool stuff, Lotrščak Tower is the place to go!

6. Enjoy panoramic views from the Zagreb Eye observation deck

Visiting Zagreb Eye in Zagreb is like seeing the city from the clouds!

It’s a super tall building with huge windows that show you a panoramic view of everything below, like a giant picture.

You can spot all the buildings, streets, and parks, and it’s even more magical during sunset when the sky turns all kinds of pretty colors.

The best part is that you can take cool pictures to remember your trip.

Inside, there’s a cozy cafe where you can have yummy snacks and drinks while enjoying the view.

It’s like being in a tall tower where you can be a sky explorer and have a delicious treat at the same time!

7. Wander through the charming streets of Tkalčićeva

Wandering through the charming streets of Tkalčićeva in Zagreb is like taking a delightful journey into the heart of the city’s soul.

The cobblestone pathways lead you past colorful buildings, cozy cafes, and quaint boutiques, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

It’s a perfect place to soak in the local culture, as you’ll see people chatting at outdoor tables, artists showcasing their creations, and musicians playing tunes that fill the air with joy.

Tkalčićeva is a hub of social life, where you can savor traditional Croatian dishes, sip on aromatic coffee, and experience the authentic buzz of Zagreb’s everyday life.

As you stroll along, you’ll discover hidden gems, unique street art, and a sense of connection that makes Tkalčićeva a must-visit destination for an unforgettable Zagreb experience.

8. Explore the Croatian Museum of Naïve Art

If you’re curious about art that’s different from the usual, you should check out the Croatian Museum of Naïve Art in Zagreb.

This museum has paintings made by regular folks who aren’t famous artists.

They paint everyday life and stories in bright colors and interesting ways. It’s like looking at pictures that tell cool tales about Croatia.

Exploring this museum is like going on a colorful adventure into the past and seeing the world through the eyes of creative people.

So, if you want to see art that’s special and tells stories in a fun way, this museum is a cool place to visit!

Also check all the best museums in Zagreb.

9. Admire the Neo-Gothic beauty of Zagreb Cathedral

Imagine visiting a big, amazing building that’s really, really old and looks like a castle.

That’s the Zagreb Cathedral!

It’s a special church where people have been praying for a long, long time.

You can see beautiful art inside and even go up high to look at the city from the top. It’s like a magical tower!

The cathedral is important for the city and its history, and it’s a peaceful place to explore and learn about Croatia’s past.

So, if you like old buildings, art, and stories, the Zagreb Cathedral is a great spot to visit!

10. Enjoy a picnic in Bundek Park

If you want to have fun outdoors, Bundek Park in Zagreb is a super place to go.

It’s like a big, green garden with a lake where you can have a picnic, run around, or ride a bike.

There are paths for walking and benches to sit and enjoy the fresh air.

You might see ducks swimming in the lake or even go paddle boating. People like to visit for games, concerts, and just relaxing.

So, if you like nature and having a good time outside, Bundek Park is a cool spot to check out!

11. Admire contemporary art at the Museum of Contemporary Art

The Museum of Contemporary Art in Zagreb is a must-visit if you’re curious about modern art.

Inside, you’ll find super cool and colorful paintings, sculptures, and other art things. It’s like stepping into a world where artists use their imagination to create amazing stuff.

You can see how art has changed over time and even discover new artists.

The museum is big and has lots of interesting rooms to explore, each with its own special art.

So, if you like art that’s different and want to see what artists are making today, the Museum of Contemporary Art is a really neat place to go!

12. Learn about Croatian history at the Croatian History Museum

Visiting the Croatian History Museum is like going on a time-travel adventure to learn about Croatia’s past.

You’ll see old things like ancient tools, cool clothes, and even ancient treasures. It’s like a history book come to life!

Inside, there are special rooms that show how people used to live, fight, and build their country. You can also see important stuff from different times, like when kings and queens ruled.

So, if you’re curious about how Croatia became the awesome place it is today, the Croatian History Museum is a fantastic spot to explore!

13. Discover the Museum of Broken Relationships

Exploring the Museum of Broken Relationships is like reading secret stories about people’s feelings.

It’s a special place where you can see things that remind them of past relationships, like love letters and gifts.

Each thing has a story that makes you feel emotions.

It’s like stepping into a world of memories and understanding.

The museum helps you see how relationships can be happy or sad, and how people move on.

So, if you’re curious about love and feelings, the Museum of Broken Relationships is a unique and touching place to visit!

14. Walk through the historic Stone Gate (Kamenita vrata)

Visiting the historic Stone Gate is like entering a magical portal to old times. It’s an ancient gateway that has a special feeling.

People light candles there and make wishes.

Inside, you can see a painting of Mary, and it’s said to be miraculous.

The gate survived a fire long ago, so it’s really important for the city’s history.

If you want to feel the ancient vibes and make a wish, the Stone Gate is a must-see spot in Zagreb!

15. Enjoy a leisurely walk around Jarun Lake

Visiting Jarun Lake is like stepping into a nature wonderland in the heart of Zagreb.

It’s a big lake where you can have lots of outdoor fun.

You can swim, go in paddle boats, and even relax on the sandy beaches.

There’s a cool path around the lake for walking or biking, and you can see beautiful views.

People come here to play sports, have picnics, and enjoy the sunshine.

So, if you like nature and want to have a great time outside, Jarun Lake is a fantastic place to visit in Zagreb!

Visit the Zagreb City Museum for an overview of the city’s history

16. Learn about meteorites at the Zagreb Meteorological Observatory

Visiting the Zagreb Meteorological Observatory is like becoming a weather detective!

It’s a place where smart people study the weather and help us know if it will be sunny or rainy.

You can see big machines and tools they use to learn about the sky.

It’s like a secret lab where they predict the weather like magic.

You’ll also learn about clouds, rainbows, and storms in a fun way.

So, if you want to know more about the sky and become a weather expert, the Meteorological Observatory is a super cool place to discover in Zagreb!

17. Explore the Archaeological Museum and its ancient artifacts

Visiting the Archaeological Museum is like going on a time-travel adventure to the past.

It’s a place full of ancient treasures like shiny jewelry, old tools, and mysterious artifacts.

You can see things that people used long, long ago and learn about their way of life.

The museum has lots of cool stories about kings, queens, and everyday folks from a really long time ago.

It’s like opening a history book and seeing real things from the old days.

So, if you’re curious about history and want to see amazing relics, the Archaeological Museum is a fantastic place to explore in Zagreb!

18. Relax and Rejuvenate at Zrinjevac Park

Visiting Zrinjevac Park is like stepping into a calm and peaceful world right in the city.

It’s a beautiful park with colorful flowers, tall trees, and a cute little music pavilion.

You can take a leisurely stroll on the paths or sit on benches to enjoy the fresh air.

In spring, the park bursts with pretty flowers, and in winter, it turns into a magical wonderland with twinkling lights.

People come here to relax, read books, and have picnics.

So, if you want a quiet escape from the city hustle, Zrinjevac Park is a perfect place to unwind and enjoy nature in Zagreb!

19. Experience Magic at the Museum of Illusions

Visiting the Museum of Illusions is like entering a world of tricks and fun!

It’s a place where your eyes might play tricks on you, and things are not what they seem.

You can see crazy stuff like rooms that make you look big or small, and even paintings that come to life. It’s like a big play area where you can take funny pictures and laugh a lot.

You’ll learn about how our brains work and how we see things differently.

So, if you want to have a mind-bending adventure and lots of laughs, the Museum of Illusions is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

20. Explore the Zagreb Zoo and its diverse wildlife

Visiting Zagreb Zoo is like going on a safari adventure without leaving the city!

It’s a big park where you can see amazing animals from all around the world.

You’ll meet friendly elephants, playful monkeys, and even roaring lions. It’s like a nature paradise where animals live in cool habitats.

You can learn about wildlife and how to protect our planet too.

If you love animals and want to have a wild day of fun, Zagreb Zoo is a fantastic place to visit with your family and friends!

21. Unveil Science Wonders at Technical Museum Nikola Tesla

Visiting the Technical Museum Nikola Tesla is like taking a journey into the world of science and inventions.

It’s a place where you can see cool machines, gadgets, and learn about how things work.

You’ll discover the amazing ideas of Nikola Tesla, a smart person who invented cool stuff.

It’s like a playground for curious minds, with interactive exhibits and hands-on activities.

You can learn about electricity, engines, and even try experiments yourself.

So, if you’re curious about science and want to have a day of learning and fun, the Technical Museum Nikola Tesla is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

22. Discover Natural Beauty at the Botanical Garden

Visiting the Botanical Garden is like entering a magical forest full of amazing plants and flowers.

It’s a peaceful place where you can walk among colorful blooms and tall trees.

You’ll see plants from faraway lands and learn their names and stories.

It’s like a nature adventure where you can relax and enjoy the fresh air.

There are pretty ponds and quiet corners to sit and rest.

So, if you love nature and want to explore a beautiful garden, the Botanical Garden is a wonderful spot to visit in Zagreb!

23. Discover Mirogoj Cemetery’s Cultural Significance

Mirogoj Cemetery in Zagreb is more than a final resting place; it’s a place of historical importance.

With its majestic arcades, towering cypress trees, and beautiful sculptures, the cemetery is like a museum of art and architecture.

Notable figures from Croatia’s past rest here, making it a unique opportunity to learn about the country’s history.

Walking through its serene paths, you’ll see diverse religious symbols and styles, reflecting Croatia’s cultural diversity.

So, if you’re interested in art, history, and culture, a visit to Mirogoj Cemetery offers a fascinating glimpse into Zagreb’s past and the lives that have shaped it.

24. Explore the Museum of Torture’s Dark History

Venturing into the Museum of Torture in Zagreb takes you on a chilling journey back in time.

It’s a place where you can learn about punishments and devices used in the past to control and intimidate.

This museum offers a unique opportunity to understand the evolution of justice and how society has changed.

You’ll see real artifacts and replicas that shed light on the harsh methods employed centuries ago.

While it might send shivers down your spine, a visit to the Museum of Torture provides a sobering reminder of human history and the progress we’ve made since then.

25. Embrace Nature’s Beauty at Maksimir Park

Maksimir Park in Zagreb is a green oasis that’s perfect for a day of relaxation and outdoor fun.

It’s like a huge garden with lovely walking paths, tall trees, and peaceful lakes.

You can have a picnic, play games, or simply enjoy the fresh air.

The park has a cool zoo where you can see animals from all over the world.

It’s a fantastic place to connect with nature and escape the city buzz while exploring scenic landscapes and encountering friendly animals.

26. Dive into Zagreb’s Past at the Museum of the City

The Museum of the City of Zagreb is like a time machine that tells the story of the city’s history.

Inside, you’ll find old things like clothes, tools, and paintings that show how people used to live.

It’s a place to learn about the city’s traditions, culture, and important events.

You can see how Zagreb grew from a small place to the lively city it is now.

Exploring this museum is like taking a journey through time and discovering the heart of Zagreb’s identity.

27. Enjoy outdoor activities at Medvednica Nature Park

Medvednica Nature Park in Zagreb is like a giant playground for nature lovers.

It’s a big area with forests, hills, and hiking trails where you can explore and have fun.

You can go for a walk, see beautiful views, and even find hidden caves.

It’s a home for animals like deer and rabbits, and you might spot them while you’re there.

Visiting this park is like taking a break from the city and immersing yourself in the beauty of Croatia’s nature.

Whether you’re into hiking, picnicking, or simply enjoying the outdoors, Medvednica Nature Park offers a refreshing and adventurous escape.

28. Explore Hidden Depths at Grič Tunnel

Grič Tunnel in Zagreb is like a secret passage under the city!

It’s a long tunnel that was used a long time ago for hiding and staying safe during wars.

Now, it’s a cool place to walk and see colorful lights that make it look magical.

It’s a unique experience to be underground and feel the history around you.

You can also find art and exhibitions inside the tunnel, making it a blend of history and creativity.

So, if you’re up for an underground adventure, Grič Tunnel is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

29. Step into the Past at Archaeological Park Andautonia

Visiting Archaeological Park Andautonia in Zagreb is like discovering an ancient Roman town!

It’s a place where you can see real remains of buildings, streets, and even a cool amphitheater.

You’ll feel like a time traveler walking where Romans used to live.

The park has signs that explain everything, so you’ll learn a lot about history.

It’s a chance to see how people lived a long time ago and imagine life in the past.

So, if you’re curious about ancient times, Archaeological Park Andautonia is a fascinating destination to explore in Zagreb!

30. Ride Back in Time at Zagreb Tram Museum

The Zagreb Tram Museum is like a magical place where you can see old trams that used to run through the city.

You can explore different kinds of trams and learn how they helped people get around in the past.

Inside, you’ll find vintage tickets, uniforms, and even a tram simulator to play with.

It’s a chance to feel like a tram driver and imagine the city’s history.

If you’re curious about transportation and want a fun way to learn, visiting the Tram Museum is a must-do activity in Zagreb!

31. Discover the urban oasis of Ribnjak Park

Ribnjak Park in Zagreb is like a peaceful haven where you can escape the city bustle.

It’s a small, charming park with pretty pathways, benches, and a pond.

You can take a leisurely stroll, sit by the water, and enjoy the serenity.

It’s a great place for a relaxing picnic or reading a book surrounded by greenery.

With its tranquil atmosphere and lovely views, Ribnjak Park offers a tranquil retreat for those seeking a moment of calm in the heart of the city.

32. Admire the Baroque beauty of St. Catherine’s Church

Visiting St. Catherine’s Church is like stepping into a beautiful treasure chest of art and history.

It’s a pretty church with colorful decorations, shiny paintings, and a tall tower.

You can see intricate details and learn about the stories behind the art. Inside, it’s calm and peaceful, a nice place for a moment of quiet reflection.

If you’re curious about old churches and want to admire lovely artworks, St. Catherine’s Church is a must-see spot in Zagreb!

33. Immerse in Art at the Museum of Contemporary Art

The Museum of Contemporary Art is like a colorful playground of modern art.

Inside, you’ll find paintings, sculptures, and cool things that artists made recently.

It’s a place where you can see how art has changed and evolved over time.

You might see artworks that make you think, smile, or feel curious.

Exploring this museum is like taking a creative journey through the minds of artists today.

So, if you’re into new and exciting art, the Museum of Contemporary Art is a fantastic place to explore in Zagreb!

34. Explore the innovative Chocolate Museum Zagreb

Visiting the Chocolate Museum is like entering a sweet wonderland where chocolate dreams come true.

It’s a place where you can learn how chocolate is made, from bean to bar.

You’ll see machines, tools, and even taste samples along the way. It’s a fun and tasty journey that’s perfect for chocolate lovers of all ages.

Exploring this museum is like a treat for your senses, and you’ll leave with a deeper appreciation for the world of chocolate-making.

If you want to satisfy your sweet tooth and learn something new, the Chocolate Museum is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

35. Immerse in Animation Magic at Animafest Zagreb

Attending Animafest Zagreb is like stepping into a world of animated wonders!

This awesome festival happens every year in June and is all about cool and creative cartoons.

You can watch short films, big films, and even meet the talented people who make them.

It’s a chance to see animations from all over the globe and experience different styles.

The festival also has workshops where you can learn how to create your own animations.

So, if you love cartoons and want to be part of an amazing animation adventure, don’t miss Animafest Zagreb in June!

36. Attend the Zagreb Advent for festive holiday celebrations

Zagreb Advent is like a magical winter wonderland that happens every December.

It’s a time when the city comes alive with twinkling lights, festive markets, and joyful celebrations.

You can wander through cozy streets filled with holiday decorations and tasty treats.

There are fun activities for kids and grown-ups, like ice skating and concerts.

The atmosphere is warm and cheerful, making it a perfect place to get into the holiday spirit.

If you want to experience the enchantment of winter and celebrate the festive season, don’t miss Zagreb Advent in December!

37. Explore the Maksimir Stadium, home to GNK Dinamo Zagreb

Visiting Maksimir Stadium is like entering the heart of Croatian football. It’s where the GNK Dinamo Zagreb team plays exciting matches!

The stadium is big and has a special energy when fans cheer for their team.

You can watch thrilling games and see talented players in action.

The atmosphere is electric, and you’ll feel the passion of the crowd.

So, if you’re a football fan or just want to experience the excitement of a live match, Maksimir Stadium is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

38. Learn about Croatian sports at the Croatian Sports Museum

Visiting the Croatian Sports Museum is like entering a hall of fame for athletes!

It’s a place where you can learn about famous sports stars from Croatia.

You’ll see their jerseys, trophies, and even equipment they used to play.

The museum tells stories of victories and records, inspiring you to reach for your goals.

It’s like a journey through the exciting world of sports, from soccer to tennis and more.

So, if you love sports and want to celebrate the achievements of Croatian athletes, the Croatian Sports Museum is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

39. Admire the contemporary architecture of the Mimara Museum

Visiting Mimara Museum is like stepping into a treasure trove of art and history.

It’s a big museum with beautiful paintings, sculptures, and fancy things from all around the world.

You’ll see famous artworks and learn about different cultures.

The museum has cool exhibits about old times and how people used to live.

It’s a place to discover amazing art and learn interesting stories from the past.

So, if you’re curious about culture and want to see impressive masterpieces, Mimara Museum is a must-see destination in Zagreb!

40. Capture Memories at the Museum of Selfies and Memories

Visiting the Museum of Selfies and Memories is like stepping into a world of creativity and fun.

It’s a unique place where you can take cool photos and make special memories.

The museum has different rooms with colorful backdrops and props that you can use for awesome selfies.

It’s like a big playground for your imagination, and you’ll have a blast striking poses and being silly.

You can also learn about the history of photography and how selfies have become a part of our lives.

So, if you want to have a joyful and interactive experience, the Museum of Selfies and Memories is a must-visit destination in Zagreb!

41. Enjoy traditional Croatian cuisine at local restaurants

Eating traditional Croatian food at local restaurants in Zagreb is like taking your taste buds on a delightful journey.

You can try dishes like hearty stews, tasty pastries, and fresh seafood.

The restaurants serve food made with love and ingredients from the region.

It’s a chance to experience the flavors of Croatia and get a taste of the local culture.

Whether you’re a foodie or just curious about new tastes, enjoying Croatian cuisine at local eateries is a must-do for a truly authentic Zagreb experience!

42. Visit the Ethnographic Museum for insights into Croatian culture

Visiting the Ethnographic Museum is like stepping into a world of traditions and customs.

It’s a place where you can learn about how people used to live in Croatia long ago.

Inside, you’ll find objects like clothing, tools, and crafts that tell stories of daily life.

It’s a chance to see different cultures and understand how they shaped the country.

Exploring this museum is like a journey through time, offering insights into the rich heritage and diversity of Croatia’s people.

If you’re curious about history and culture, the Ethnographic Museum is a must-visit spot in Zagreb!

43. Feel the Excitement at Arena Zagreb Sports Hall

Experiencing an event at Arena Zagreb is like being part of a thrilling sports or entertainment spectacle!

This modern sports hall hosts various events, from exciting basketball and handball games to concerts and shows.

It’s a massive venue with comfy seats and great views from every angle.

You can feel the energy of the crowd and cheer for your favorite teams or artists.

Throughout the year, Arena Zagreb hosts a wide range of events, making it a vibrant hub of entertainment for locals and visitors alike.

So, if you’re looking to immerse yourself in the excitement of sports and entertainment, check out the event calendar and don’t miss a visit to Arena Zagreb during your trip!
